storyTitle: As Manager, I want to submit schedule change requests to achieve proper approval and tracking

testCases.title: Submit schedule change request with valid data
preconditions: Manager user account exists and is active
Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials
Manager has authorization to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change request form is accessible
At least one approver is configured in the workflow
Valid document files are prepared for attachment (PDF, DOC, or DOCX format, under 10MB)

steps.action: Manager navigates to schedule change request page from the main dashboard or menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields clearly marked (employee name, current schedule, proposed schedule, effective date, reason for change, and document attachment option)

steps.action: Manager enters employee name in the designated field
steps.expectedResult: Employee name is accepted and displayed in the field without validation errors

steps.action: Manager enters current schedule details (days and times)
steps.expectedResult: Current schedule information is accepted and properly formatted in the field

steps.action: Manager enters proposed schedule details (days and times)
steps.expectedResult: Proposed schedule information is accepted and properly formatted in the field

steps.action: Manager selects effective date using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Selected date is populated in the effective date field and is in the correct format (MM/DD/YYYY)

steps.action: Manager enters reason for schedule change in the text area
steps.expectedResult: Reason text is accepted and displayed in the text area without character limit errors

steps.action: Manager clicks on the attachment button and selects valid document files (PDF format, 2MB size)
steps.expectedResult: Files are successfully attached, file names are displayed, and no validation errors appear

steps.action: Manager reviews all entered information for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All fields display the entered data correctly and no validation errors are present

steps.action: Manager clicks the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System displays a confirmation message stating 'Schedule change request submitted successfully' with a unique request ID, request is routed to the first approver in the configured workflow, and manager receives an email notification confirming submission

steps.action: Manager navigates to the request tracking page
steps.expectedResult: Submitted request appears in the list with status 'Pending Approval' and displays the assigned approver name

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the database with status 'Pending Approval'
Request is assigned to the first approver in the workflow queue
Manager receives confirmation email with request ID
Approver receives notification of new pending request
Request is visible in manager's submitted requests list
Audit log entry is created for the submission

testCases.title: Reject submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: Manager user account exists and is active
Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials
Manager has authorization to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change request form is accessible
Real-time validation is enabled on the form

steps.action: Manager navigates to schedule change request page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request submission form is displayed with all mandatory fields clearly marked with asterisks (*)

steps.action: Manager leaves the employee name field empty and moves to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers and displays error message 'Employee name is required' in red text below the field, and the field border turns red

steps.action: Manager leaves the current schedule field empty and moves to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers and displays error message 'Current schedule is required' in red text below the field, and the field border turns red

steps.action: Manager leaves the proposed schedule field empty and moves to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers and displays error message 'Proposed schedule is required' in red text below the field, and the field border turns red

steps.action: Manager leaves the effective date field empty and moves to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers and displays error message 'Effective date is required' in red text below the field, and the field border turns red

steps.action: Manager leaves the reason for change field empty
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers and displays error message 'Reason for change is required' in red text below the field, and the field border turns red

steps.action: Manager attempts to click the Submit button with all mandatory fields still empty
steps.expectedResult: Submit button is disabled (grayed out) and cannot be clicked, or if clicked, displays a summary error message at the top of the form stating 'Please complete all mandatory fields before submitting' with a list of missing fields

steps.action: Manager fills in only the employee name field and attempts to submit again
steps.expectedResult: Submission is still blocked, and error messages remain visible for all other empty mandatory fields

steps.action: Manager scrolls through the form to view all validation errors
steps.expectedResult: All mandatory fields that are empty display individual error messages, and the form clearly indicates which fields need to be completed

postconditions: No schedule change request is created in the database
Form remains on the submission page with all entered data preserved
All validation error messages remain visible
No notifications are sent to approvers
No confirmation email is sent to the manager
Manager can correct the errors and resubmit

testCases.title: Validate attachment file types and sizes
preconditions: Manager user account exists and is active
Manager is logged into the system with valid credentials
Manager has authorization to submit schedule change requests
Schedule change request form is accessible
Test files are prepared: unsupported file type (e.g., .exe, .zip), oversized file (e.g., 15MB PDF), and valid file (e.g., 2MB PDF)

steps.action: Manager navigates to schedule change request page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request submission form is displayed with attachment section visible

steps.action: Manager fills in all mandatory fields with valid data (employee name, current schedule, proposed schedule, effective date, reason for change)
steps.expectedResult: All mandatory fields accept the data without validation errors

steps.action: Manager clicks on the attachment button and attempts to select an unsupported file type (e.g., .exe file)
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message 'File type not supported. Please upload PDF, DOC, or DOCX files only' and the file is not attached

steps.action: Manager clicks on the attachment button and attempts to select an oversized file (e.g., 15MB PDF file)
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message 'File size exceeds maximum limit of 10MB. Please upload a smaller file' and the file is not attached

steps.action: Manager attempts to submit the form without any valid attachments
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message 'At least one valid document attachment is required' and submission is blocked

steps.action: Manager clicks on the attachment button and selects a valid file (e.g., 2MB PDF file)
steps.expectedResult: File is successfully attached, file name and size are displayed in the attachment section, and a green checkmark or success indicator appears

steps.action: Manager adds another valid file (e.g., 3MB DOCX file)
steps.expectedResult: Second file is successfully attached and both files are listed in the attachment section with their names and sizes

steps.action: Manager reviews the form to ensure all data is correct and valid files are attached
steps.expectedResult: All fields display correct data, valid attachments are listed, and no validation errors are present

steps.action: Manager clicks the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message 'Schedule change request submitted successfully' with a unique request ID, request is routed to the first approver, and attached files are included with the request

steps.action: Manager navigates to the request tracking page and opens the submitted request
steps.expectedResult: Request details page displays all attached files with download links, and files can be successfully downloaded and opened

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the database with status 'Pending Approval'
Valid attached files are stored in the document repository and linked to the request
Invalid file attempts are logged but not stored
Request is assigned to the first approver with access to attachments
Manager receives confirmation email with request ID
Approver can view and download all attached documents

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to review and approve schedule change requests to ensure authorized modifications

testCases.title: Approve schedule change request successfully
preconditions: Approver user account exists and is active
Approver is logged into the system with valid credentials
Approver has authorization role to approve schedule change requests
At least one schedule change request is pending approval and assigned to the approver
Request contains all required information and valid attachments
Manager who submitted the request has a valid email address for notifications

steps.action: Approver logs into the system and navigates to the pending approvals dashboard from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Pending approvals dashboard is displayed showing a list of all schedule change requests assigned to the approver with columns for request ID, employee name, submission date, and status

steps.action: Approver reviews the list of pending requests
steps.expectedResult: List displays all pending requests with accurate information, sorted by submission date (newest first), and shows the total count of pending requests

steps.action: Approver clicks on a specific schedule change request from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying full information including employee name, current schedule, proposed schedule, effective date, reason for change, submission date, requester name, and attached documents section

steps.action: Approver reviews the current schedule details
steps.expectedResult: Current schedule information is clearly displayed with days and times in an easy-to-read format

steps.action: Approver reviews the proposed schedule details
steps.expectedResult: Proposed schedule information is clearly displayed with days and times, and differences from current schedule are highlighted or easily identifiable

steps.action: Approver reviews the reason for change provided by the manager
steps.expectedResult: Reason for change is displayed in full text and is clearly readable

steps.action: Approver clicks on the attached document link to view supporting documentation
steps.expectedResult: Document opens in a new tab or viewer, displays correctly, and content is readable

steps.action: Approver closes the document and returns to the request details page
steps.expectedResult: Request details page remains open with all information intact

steps.action: Approver clicks the Approve button
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking 'Are you sure you want to approve this schedule change request?' with optional comment field and Confirm/Cancel buttons

steps.action: Approver enters optional approval comment (e.g., 'Approved as requested') and clicks Confirm button
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message 'Schedule change request approved successfully', request status updates to 'Approved', approval timestamp is recorded, and approver is redirected to the pending approvals dashboard

steps.action: Approver verifies the approved request is no longer in the pending list
steps.expectedResult: Approved request is removed from the pending approvals list, and the pending count is decremented by one

steps.action: Approver navigates to the approval history or completed approvals section
steps.expectedResult: Approved request appears in the completed approvals list with status 'Approved', approval date, and approver name

steps.action: Manager (requester) checks their email inbox
steps.expectedResult: Manager receives email notification with subject 'Schedule Change Request Approved' containing request ID, approval date, approver name, and optional approval comment

postconditions: Schedule change request status is updated to 'Approved' in the database
Approval timestamp and approver ID are recorded in the request record
Manager receives email notification of approval
Request is removed from approver's pending queue
Request appears in approval history with complete audit trail
Approved request is available for next workflow step if configured
System logs the approval action for audit purposes

testCases.title: Reject schedule change request with mandatory comment
preconditions: Approver user account exists and is active
Approver is logged into the system with valid credentials
Approver has authorization role to reject schedule change requests
At least one schedule change request is pending approval and assigned to the approver
Request contains all required information
Manager who submitted the request has a valid email address for notifications
Rejection comment is configured as mandatory in system settings

steps.action: Approver navigates to the pending approvals dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Pending approvals dashboard is displayed showing a list of all schedule change requests assigned to the approver

steps.action: Approver selects a schedule change request to reject by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying full information including employee name, current schedule, proposed schedule, effective date, reason for change, and attached documents

steps.action: Approver reviews the request details and determines it should be rejected
steps.expectedResult: All request information is visible and clearly displayed for review

steps.action: Approver clicks the Reject button
steps.expectedResult: Rejection dialog appears with a mandatory comment text area field marked with an asterisk (*), character counter showing minimum required characters (e.g., 10 characters minimum), and Confirm/Cancel buttons

steps.action: Approver leaves the comment field empty and attempts to click the Confirm button
steps.expectedResult: System prevents rejection and displays validation error message 'Rejection comment is required. Please provide a reason for rejection' in red text below the comment field, and the Confirm button remains disabled or clicking it has no effect

steps.action: Approver enters only 3 characters in the comment field (below minimum requirement)
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message 'Comment must be at least 10 characters long' and the Confirm button remains disabled

steps.action: Approver clears the field and enters a valid rejection comment with sufficient detail (e.g., 'The proposed schedule conflicts with operational requirements and cannot be accommodated at this time')
steps.expectedResult: Comment is accepted, character counter shows the comment meets minimum requirements, validation error disappears, and the Confirm button becomes enabled

steps.action: Approver clicks the Confirm button to submit the rejection
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message 'Schedule change request rejected successfully', request status updates to 'Rejected', rejection timestamp is recorded, and approver is redirected to the pending approvals dashboard

steps.action: Approver verifies the rejected request is no longer in the pending list
steps.expectedResult: Rejected request is removed from the pending approvals list, and the pending count is decremented by one

steps.action: Approver navigates to the approval history or completed approvals section
steps.expectedResult: Rejected request appears in the completed approvals list with status 'Rejected', rejection date, approver name, and rejection comment visible

steps.action: Manager (requester) checks their email inbox
steps.expectedResult: Manager receives email notification with subject 'Schedule Change Request Rejected' containing request ID, rejection date, approver name, and the full rejection comment explaining the reason

steps.action: Manager logs into the system and navigates to their submitted requests
steps.expectedResult: Rejected request is displayed with status 'Rejected' and the rejection comment is visible in the request details

postconditions: Schedule change request status is updated to 'Rejected' in the database
Rejection timestamp, approver ID, and rejection comment are recorded in the request record
Manager receives email notification of rejection with detailed comment
Request is removed from approver's pending queue
Request appears in approval history with complete audit trail including rejection reason
Manager can view rejection details and resubmit a modified request if needed
System logs the rejection action for audit purposes

testCases.title: Prevent unauthorized access to approval tasks
preconditions: Multiple user accounts exist with different roles (approver, manager, regular employee)
User without approver role is logged into the system with valid credentials
User has a role such as 'Manager' or 'Employee' but not 'Approver'
Role-based access control (RBAC) is properly configured in the system
At least one schedule change request exists in pending approval status
Approval dashboard URL is known (e.g., /approvals/pending)

steps.action: User without approver role logs into the system successfully
steps.expectedResult: User is logged in and redirected to their appropriate dashboard based on their role (e.g., manager dashboard or employee dashboard)

steps.action: User reviews the main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Navigation menu does not display 'Pending Approvals' or 'Approval Dashboard' option, as user does not have approver role

steps.action: User manually types the approval dashboard URL in the browser address bar (e.g., /approvals/pending) and presses Enter
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays error page with HTTP 403 Forbidden status and message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to access this page. Approver role is required.'

steps.action: User attempts to navigate back using browser back button
steps.expectedResult: User is returned to their previous authorized page or dashboard

steps.action: User attempts to access a specific approval task by manually entering the URL with a request ID (e.g., /approvals/12345)
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays error page with HTTP 403 Forbidden status and message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this approval task'

steps.action: User attempts to access the approval API endpoint directly using browser developer tools or API client (e.g., GET /api/approvals/pending)
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden response with JSON error message {'error': 'Unauthorized', 'message': 'Approver role required to access this resource'}

steps.action: User attempts to submit an approval decision via API endpoint (e.g., POST /api/approvals/12345/decision)
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden response with JSON error message {'error': 'Unauthorized', 'message': 'You do not have permission to approve or reject requests'}

steps.action: System administrator reviews the security audit log
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains entries for all unauthorized access attempts with timestamp, user ID, attempted URL, and 'Access Denied' result

steps.action: User logs out and logs back in to verify role has not changed
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in but still does not have access to approval features, confirming role-based restrictions are persistent

postconditions: User without approver role remains unable to access approval dashboard
No schedule change requests are modified or accessed by unauthorized user
All unauthorized access attempts are logged in the security audit trail
System security integrity is maintained
User's own role and permissions remain unchanged
No data breach or unauthorized data access occurs
Error messages do not reveal sensitive system information
